data.title: The best pork chop I had
data.text: Came here with two business partners on a chilly evening at their recommendations. Definitely the highlight of the week. Perhaps the best pork chops I had in my life - cooked to perfection, succulent and juicy with the perfect sauce. Can't remember what I had and drank after that.

data.title: Pleasant dinner, lovely venue.
data.text: Visited Rochester with my granddaughter.  Very nice wine list, professional and accommodating service, food good but not great.  That said, the area where we live is known for outstanding Italian food, so we may be a bit spoiled.

data.title: Very nice
data.text: Place was recommended to us by locals. Answered all expectations. Very nice mood inside. Staff was really friendly and helpful. And the food was excellent.

data.title: Very hospitable - great service and food!
data.text: The host makes you feel like you're in her home and the couple singing in the corner made for a romantic evening!

data.title: can't wait to return
data.text: excellent restaurant I felt like I was at home food tasted home made not chain food service was excellent very pleasant music was nice they looked like a couple portions were enough gave directions back to hotel will be back soon

data.title: Delicious Italian Family Dinner
data.text: We were seated within ten minutes of our reservation at this busy Italian restaurant on the water. The building is older and the restaurant is beautifully laid out and simply decorated. We had the asparagus chicken, chicken parmesan, vodka penne, veal parmesan and the spaghetti carbonara. All the food was fantastic and we would return for that alone. Possibly because this was a busy Friday night, we did feel rushed; our waitress never even told us the specials. We were well served, though, by the bus staff and the food arrived promptly.

data.title: Delightful
data.text: Had a special Birthday dinner at Pane Vino last week and it was delightful.  The service was perfect, our server was friendly and spent just the right amount of time with us...no "hovering"... and the food was excellent.  I had the Pesto Tortellini and it was really yummy!  There was enough left over for dinner the next day and lunch the following day!  They make a mean Cosmo that was delicious!  They presented me with two mini cannolis in honor of my birthday which was a nice touch.  They also have a special private area for an intimate and romantic dining experience.  We didn't sit there this time because we were with another couple, but did at our last visit and it was wonderful.

data.title: Birthday dinner
data.text: Had a lovely birthday dinner for our dad's 85th birthday. We had a wonderful time. We were a large group and they were very accommodating. Food was very good. I liked that they had valet parking. I would definitely go back.

data.title: Dinner with my visiting daughter
data.text: The service, atmosphere and food were exceptional. The music was lovely and I had the best chicken french of my life!

data.title: Wonderful!
data.text: Had a very nice meal with friends. There is limited street parking but they have valet parking for customers. We had reservations and we were promptly seated. The place is tastefully decorated and cozy. The weather didn't cooperate for us but the outdoor seating looked amazing. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and friendly. Great wine list. We ordered the artichoke ravioli and chicken Parmesan which we loved. A little on the pricey side but good portions. Not much on the menu for vegetarians.

data.title: Very nice little place, a very nice meal.
data.text: This is the 7th time we have been to Rochester for an event always held on Labor Day weekend.  While walking the city one morning I found a small restaurant named Pane Vino.  My wife and I gave it a try that evening and were VERY glad that we did.  Although outside seating overlooking the river was available, we opted to eat inside the restaurant.  The servers were helpful and most pleasant.  The meals were excellent - well worth the price.  We will obviously go back to this spot again next year when we return to Rochester.  The only drawback (for those who must drive to this establishment) is that there is no parking along this street.  The restaurant does, however, offer valet parking.

data.title: What a surprise as well as a prize!
data.text:
I always like the small local restaurants and was fortunate enough to get guided to this one by the hotel shuttle driver. Starting with the Caprese salad with the best balsamic I have ever had (and I am a balsamic expert) through the littleneck steamed clams served in a unique broth, everything was a culinary delight. 

Not only was the food excellent but the service and attitudes of the staff were exactly what one would hope for (feeling welcome and valued.)  I sat at the bar and mentioned to the server (Nicole) that I would love to get the Caprese salad but was concerned I would then not have room for the steamed clams. She immediately offered up a half order and I am so glad she did as it was excellent. I asked what brand balsamic they use she explained they make their own & gave me a small container to take home. when I overlooked the detail that the steamed clams had hot red pepper flakes in the broth the owner (or chef)  graciously remade it for me without my even asking. 

If you are ever in Rochester and love Italian food this place is a must!

data.title: Great, as always!
data.text:
We went with a few couples and had a fantastic night.  Everything we ordered was delicious, including a few of us who got the specials.  Server was great, very fun and attentive. Drinks were perfect and we got everything from wine to beer to martinis.  

The music in the bar was very senior citizen oriented but it wasn't terrible.  We are in our 30s and we felt a little young but that isn't the normal vibe that we have seen before. 

We will definitely be back!

data.title: If you like cold pasta, this place is great!
data.text:
While there was a lovely outdoor patio with a view of the water that's the only part of this restaurant that I enjoyed.

The mango Bellini tasted like orange juice and I sent it back. 

I ordered the chicken parm and while the chicken was okay the pasta was as cold as it had just been removed from the refrigerator. I asked the waitress to feel the pasta and she refused and took my plate offering to bring me a new plate of pasta. By then it had taken so long to get my food I told her to forget it as my 2 companions we almost done with their meals. I had to ask twice for butter and when asked for more bread it never came.

I'm sure there are plenty of other restaurants to try while you're in town because this one was a complete an utter disappointment for me.

I gave it 2 stars because my companions steak was cooked well and she liked it.

data.title: Delicious food, superb service, sophisticated atmosphere!
data.text: This is a great place to celebrate anniversaries and other special occasions.  The food and service are second to none.

data.title: So friendly and delightful
data.text: I was looking for dinner on a Monday in downtown Rochester.  I stumbled on this delightful restaurant and was able to sit outside.  Lobster ravioli and cannolli.  Great house Chanti.  What's not to love?

data.title: Never made it to main course
data.text:
We were staying downtown Rochester at the Hyatt and heard about Pane Vino for quite some time. Made 8pm reservations a week in advance. Upon arriving, valet parking was a nice touch because parking is hard to find and it's the best of areas. Charming inside, dim lighting, bar immediately when you walk in, seating to the back and also outdoor patio. We chose outdoor patio overlooking the river, was nice. Had a good server, Alexis, who was helpful with the menu. My wife and I each ordered glass of wine, was happy to see they carry Josh Cabernet, one of my favorites. 

We ordered 1 appetizer, 2 salads, and 2 main courses. We were seated at 8pm and the appetizer didn't come until 8:45. We rolled with it thinking the salads would be any minute and main course soon to follow. Salads didn't come until 9pm and main courses not until 9:35. Alexis knew we weren't happy by look on our faces and bought us round of drinks at around 9:20. Having eaten the app and salads and our stomachs settling in for so long I physically couldn't even eat the entree when it came out. Politely told the manager neither of us were interested in the main dishes at that point and he took them both off the bill.

Obviously I would have loved to try the food out but overly disappointed by the amount of time it took to get served. Apparently the kitchen was backed up. We weren't the only ones who said something, a couple next to us left as well. I guess it wasn't a great night for them. Too bad...

data.title: Another visit, another great meal!
data.text: Formerly from Rochester, Pane Vino was on our list of return to restaurants.  It did not disappoint.  From the ambiance, friendly staff and GREAT food, it is still on the top of our Rochester favorites.

data.title: Lunch was Great!!
data.text: On a hot day my husband and I were looking for a good place for lunch with an outdoor patio.  Pane Vino was perfect.  We ate outside on a patio along side the Genesee River.  I had a caprese salad with grilled shrimp and my better half had a pizza.  Both were very good!!  I had creme brule for a very nice ending.  We will try it again for dinner sometime.

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text:
We went for a celebration dinner and it was everything we had hoped for! 
First, the food was amazing. We had prosciutto wrapped mozzarella in a red sauce (Bocconcini) as an appetizer and it was simply delicious. A very small portion for the price, but extremely well done and delicious. For dinner we took the recommendations of our server (Leslie - who was 5 star plus!) and had house made artichoke ravioli and chicken Anthony. The artichoke ravioli was perfect, as the garlic wine sauce was so good it's hard to describe. The chicken Anthony was also something you could go back to over and over again. We ended dinner with a great peanut butter chocolate cheesecake.
We sat outside for dinner under the canopy in a charming courtyard.  We weren't rushed and felt welcomed and comfortable from the moment we walked in.

The night was nearly perfect. Nearly.  I can't end the review without noting the area where PV fell short. After dinner we went to the bar for a drink and to listen to the live music being played in the front bar area. We sat at the bar and were quickly served. A few minutes later I asked the bar tender is she would break a twenty for me so I could leave her an additional tip and have a tip for the valet (which is free by the way). There were five people total at the bar and she was serving the floor servers as well.  So not busy at all.  She smiled, asked me to wait just a minute and she would gladly make change.  For the next 20 minutes she never so much as made eye contact.  Our drinks were empty, the twenty was still sitting on the bar, and we decided it was time to leave.  Maybe it was a bad night, or maybe one or two of the others at the bar were friends that distracted her, I'm not sure.  But we walked out with a small sour taste in our mouths after what was a nearly perfect dinner. I didn't change my rating because the dinner and PV overall was fantastic and deserving of the 5 out of 5 rating. I'm not sure what happened at the bar, but I'm sure it was an anomaly.
